intro: Vrydagzynea albida var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan white vrydagzynea, is a rare flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
